content.detailedDescription:
The sky was perfectly clear, visibility about 50 miles that morning; air temp. about 82 deg. f. my mother and i were hanging out clothes to dry in the backyard of our home and we both looked straight up (directly overhead) (for no apparent reason) and saw the 16 yellow-orange tiny spheres, for the most part grouped as 4 groups of 4 spheres each. these objects would separate from each other in group formation, then come together again. we (my mother and i) watched this spectacle for approx. 10 mins. and quite literally, could not believe what we were seeing!
for about the last 3 mins. they were visible, i was observing them through 7x binoculars and there was no difference in size or appearance from the naked eye view of them, so i knew they had to be at a very great altitude. at approx. 0835 mdt the "formation" slowly drifted to the north-east and simply disappeared; not rapidly, but just as if they simply "faded slowly out" of our sight. we were truly astounded by what we had witnessed and never told anyone else about the incident, but my mother and i still can recall that clear, calm sunday morning here in southern nm when we certainly did see and observe something, the likes of which we had never seen before or after! we never heard of any reports of anyone else seeing what we did that sunday morning, august 10, 1997.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
content.summary: Directly overhead, clear sky, 16, (4 groups of 4,) yellow-orange tiny spheres.

content.detailedDescription:
On sunday, feb. 1, 2009 around 9:00pm while driving home, i noticed a very bright light in the sky.  the sky was hazy that night, and it was hard to see the stars, so it was really easy to notice this 'ball' of light.
at first, i thought that maybe there was an accident and they had to fly in a helicopter and it had on its landing lights. but soon after driving closer to the object, i noticed this was not the case.   
the object was a very bright, orange in color and looked as if it was changing from orange to red.  there was no sound, and the object seemed to be 'floating' or moving very slowly in an eastern direction.
after following this object for about 10 minutes, i had to turn around and go back to where i was going to.  
this is amazing to me, and when i saw the video of the stephensville sighting in texas, that is exactly what i saw that night!!
content.summary: Bright light, round, and moving slowly.

content.detailedDescription: I walked onto my back porch to smoke a cigarette, and as i sat down i noticed  what looked at first to be an extremely bright star, or an aircraft of some sort. as i watched it i noticed it was changing colors from blue to red to orange to green.... then it went completely bright white, then would start with the series of colors again. i stood up and walked to the edge of my porch to watch it more intently and noticed that it looked like it was going from wide to thin , wide to thin, almost like it was rotating. it never moved closer or further away. it stayed in the same spot almost hovering. i watched it for about 20 minutes, while calling a friend on the phone, and calling my son & husband out to see it. finally, i walked inside to get my son's telescope, and when i came back out it was gone. this was a duration of less than a minute. as i was standing outside looking to see where it had gone i noticed something that looked exactly like what i had seen before, but in a completely different direction, and further away this time. a plane or jet could not have traveled this distance in this short amount of time. it was putting on the same light show that the first object i had seen was. then, i called a friend again to tell them what i had seen, and about 7 minutes into the phone call a bright light streaked over my house. it was like a shooting star, but it was one long string of light and much brighter than any shooting star i've ever seen. it zipped across the span of the sky in a second or less. it was faster than the anything i've ever seen, so fast like i said , that it was just a streak of very bright light, like a lazer beam. i finally went back into the house about an hour after all of this began, and the second object i had seen further off in the distance was still there, putting off a brilliant light show, never moving from that spot. i have never been interested in ufo's or payed much attention to claims of sightings, but i know i've never had any kind of experience like this before, and i hope i don't ever again. i just wanted to tell this story in the hopes that someone else will have reported it also. i can't have been the only one to see it. it was there for too long. anyway, thanks for listening.
content.summary: [tg] it looked like a bright star, but changed colors constantly, stayed in the same spot but almost looked to be rotating.

content.detailedDescription: 4 friends and i slept out in the field behind my house. we were all about 12 years old at the time. something that made no sound, "floated" over from the far end of the field and hovered directly above us. we were all in sleeping bags at the time and looking straight up. i remeber asking "do you see that?" and everyone agreeing that they were in fact staring at somthing that we could not explain. i have often wondered why we were not at all scared. seems strange. anyway, the next thing i know i'm waking up, still in the same place. not sure why or how long i've been sleeping, but the object is still there and all of us had fallen asleep and woke up again at the same time. (is it just me or does that seem kind of strange??) we continued to look at the object for a short time (few minutes?) then the object began to "float" off, continuing in the same direction that it was headed when it stopped to hover over us. when it had traveled about 100 yards away it stoped and hovered briefly, and then abruptly "shot" up and disappeared completely. the next morning, i mentioned the encounter to my mom and she just kind of laughed and thought i was joking. one of the strange things about this encounter, is that us kids never again talked about what we had seen. it has been a lot of years since this happened and although i know what took place that night, because we never talked about it, i have always had a 1% reservation about what i remembered. i have wondered "did i just dream this??" "did it realy happen??". i recently became a member of facebook, the online comunity and was contacted by one of the other people that was there that night.(i have long since lost contact with everyone that was there)  it was interesting that he made it a point of asking me what i remembered from that night. i now have no reservations about whether this realy happened. over the years, one of the things that has gone unanswered, regarding this night, was whether or not there was any "loss of time". when my friend contacted me, he was able to provide an answer: yes, he had glanced at his watch prior to falling asleep and then again after we all woke up. according to what he is telling me, he believes that we lost about an hour. this is about all of the info that i can provide, regarding this episode at this time and hope that perhaps you guys could provide me with some feedback regarding this. i'm wondering if you have had any other sightings from this area? does any part of my description of events match what others have seen? any information you could provide would be great. now that i am in contact with one of the other four who were there, i believe that with a little bit of effort, i can probobly still locate at least one more of the people who were there that night. it will be interesting to see what he says, if i can find him. two more things really quick before i go: my grandmother had an encounter in the california desert, at verry close range, as well. i have wondered if these two encounters are not some how conected?? i also have something just under the skin of my right fore arm that i have also wondered if it may have been "put" there. it is my hope to convey my sincerity regarding everything that i have told you. this realy happened. thank you.
content.summary: Silent hovering craft directly above (aprox. 150 ft).

content.detailedDescription: For many years i've wanted to express my observation of an incident that i've never come to grips with.  i'm now 65 years old.  the incident occured, i believe the summer of 1966, four miles south of petersburg, north dakota.  late one evening in the middle of the summer about 1:00 a.M. three of us guys were driving south of petersburg.  as we crested  a hill about a mile from my friends home, we seen what appeared to be a flashing red light.  our concern was that there may be fire responders at my friends place.  after a moment or two we realized that the red light was in fact pulsating-- not flashing.  we accelerated to reach the light which appeared to be in the middle of the road.  as we approached the light (within 1/4 mile) it disappeared and reappeared one mile east on highway #32.  we continued south to the section line and headed east to observe the pulsating light.  again within 1/4 mile it disappeared and reappeared approximately one mile south on highway 32 and continued to pulsate. we realized then that we would never catch it and if we did, what then.  the pulsating light disappeared and reappeared at 90 degree angles ( 1 mile increments ) in the snape of a finger.  no sound was hear.  why did the pulsating light reappear for us? was it decoying us away, like a killdeer bird from her nest?  were these multiple units or just one?  i believe it was one unit of unknown origin.  my first thought about the incident had to be related to being within 40 miles of the grand forks air force base.  we were also only 2 miles to the closest minuteman missile.  another site was about 4 miles and the third about 8 miles.  my friend told me that after this incident that he and his family seen pulsating lights the following nights appear just south of the buildings.  these sightings have been on our minds for over 40 plus years.  what did we see?  why didn't we communicate the sightings to authorities?  i never said anything to other people, i think because i was in the rotc program at the university of north dakota and did not want to jeapordize my future with the air force.  we have many questions and no answeres.  we do know that we seen something unexplainable.
content.summary: Pulsating red light.

content.detailedDescription:
This is my 2nd early morning sighting of some type of ufo in the last two months. since 12/19/08, having seen and reported a very up close ufo, i���ve felt almost paranoid to be truthful. i���ve found it best not to say too much to too many people, as they are justifiably skeptical.

since, my husband and i have been constantly looking to the skies over highlands ranch, co.

this morning, 01/03/2009, at 05:42, i was in our bedroom with the lights off. the skies were pitch black as i could see stars, and to the north, airplane���s lights approaching dia.

looking out the window, in a southwestern direction, toward the mountains, quite a ways out in the distance, i saw an extremely bright light ���falling��� straight down. at first i thought it may have been a comet (however, the light was ���brilliant��� and there was no trail) and then it stopped...Just stopped...And the brilliant white light suddenly disappeared and a horizontal strobe of varying colored lights came on the object.

still not certain of what i was seeing (i thought it may have been an airplane that had a close call and perhaps the lights were on wing tips as i was admittedly trying to talk myself out of what i was seeing) when suddenly a very long, diffused looking white light shot straight down from the object for about 2-3 seconds (the light was about 1/3 the distance between the object and the horizon from my viewpoint) and then that light went away. (if it had been daylight, i���d say it looked like a long, large jet-trail���going straight down!)

as i noted the object had been in one location for a while now, i quickly went to the living room and opened the blinds and was relieved to still be able to see it.

the view from the bedroom had been better, so i went back and as i was watching it, 2 very long, diffused looking white lights shot out horizontally (one to the left, one to the right of the object) again lasting about 2 seconds.

there had been no movement of the object now for a number of minutes. about 2 minutes later, the 2 horizontal lights came on for about 2 seconds again! then, all of the lights just disappeared.
content.summary: Sw highlands ranch, co 05:42 sighting of brilliant "falling" white light that  stopped mid-sky & became horizontal strobe lit ufo...

content.detailedDescription: I was working a security job as a supplement to being a correctional officer at brown creek correctional center.On this particular job,i could bring my wife as i sat and observed a strobe light atop a tower that would not stay on,and should it go out,i was to call my dispatch and from there they would notify the people who needed to be aware and so forth.I was in my jeep,i had the engine running,and the heat was on because it was cold for november in that region.(and my wife was with me)we arrived on site at around 11pm,we talked,ate,and eventually my wife fell asleep.I was leaned back in my seat, but was wide awake; and about 2 1/2 hours into the shift i was watching the horizon when out off the horizon in front of me,two gold lights---not yellow not amber---but gold lights alternated off and on then turned ito a deep red and shot straight up then left at an angle at an incredible speed,and it left this glowing path of glittery white light.I woke up my wife who didnt see it,anf tried to explain it to her.I ruled out fireworks because it was all too big to be fireworks,and too my knowledge we have nothing that can quite move like that.I was in the navy,a trained observer,seen some pretty cool things,but this was different.I knew there was a small airstrip nearby,but i dont think it was directly in front of my line of sight.There's no major air bases around.I remember thinking that this was just great--i dont know what it was,and i hated that i saw it,because what was it,who do you tell?---knowing there'll be no definitive answer.My wife thought i was seeing a plane but this wasnt a plane because of the way this thing moved.After a while sitting there trying to sort this out,i fell asleep.I was wide awake before and was quite astonished and a little shaken--but i fell asleep. now---all i saw were lights acting in a manner that is not within the normal scope of my knowledge as to how aircraft move,and i fell asleep in spite of my elevated mood for about a 1/2 hour.Im not saying this was filled with gray folks from eta carinae and they abducted me--but this light displayed some odd characteristics.Anyone ever reported a similar sighting? i also have 3 more incidents to report if youre interested.
content.summary: Saw two gold lights change to single red light then simply shot away.

content.detailedDescription: Additional photos of shape shifter shown previously

content.detailedDescription: The 3 attatched photos are all the same object as object 1058 and video in prior reports.  it was a shape shifter.
content.summary: Looked like extremely bright star.

content.detailedDescription: I was in the beack of my dad's truck and then i herd a weird humming noise and i saw some type of disc shaped object about the size of a small car and then it dissepeared.
content.summary: It was floating by my house at a rapid speed.

content.detailedDescription: I reported a sighting yeasterday and this morning i was out on padio again and think i figured out what i saw friday, it must have been a meteor comming straight at me and burning out as it came in, giving the illusion that it was pulling away till gone from site, sorry for bothering you with this. thanks dave.
content.summary: Light in sky.

content.detailedDescription: Already submitted description but for got i got 2min 40 sec video on tripod also. object changeds shapes.
content.summary: Looked like an extremely bright star.

content.detailedDescription: At about 2100 tonight i stepped out on my porche and noticed a light due west of me how many miles i am not sure could have been anywhere from five to ten miles away at probably 1000 ft. it was bright yellow seeming to stand in one spot. i watched this for about ten minutes and then i asked my mother to come outside to see this. that is when i remember to get my video camera. i was able to get some footage of this event before it blinked out. this is not like any plane i had ever seen before at first i thought it looked alot like military illumination that i have seen many many times being an ex sailor who was with the marines for quite a few years. but then it would suddenly flash a really bright red then go back to a yellow light. now my video isn't very good not really used to using the darn thing and lost it a couple of times while trying to zoom in on it but the video plainly shows it blinking bright red then it just blinks out and it was gone after about ten minutes. from my vantage  point it looked star like but again i was a long ways from the object. if you like i will send in the video for you to look at and analyze. please feel free to call me i am home most of the time. i would attache the video if i knew how but it is on one of those small tapes that you have to plug into your television or vcr. i know when an airplane is approaching you it can appear to stay in one spot, but this thing was there almost twenty minutes total then it blinked out.
content.summary: Bright orange yellow flashing red at times.

content.detailedDescription: I was watching a movie with my husband when my 6 year old daughter started screaming. i went to see what happened and she said her room was shaking and everything was rattling on the shelves and making noises. she also said later that she felt herself spinning and felt dizzy and nauseas. i assumed she'd had a bad dream and tried to calm her down. she asked if she could sleep in my bedroom and i,of course said yes. we were lying on my bed in the dark chatting, when suddenly through the tiny crack in the curtain, a really small thin laser,very thin but really bright light hit me in my left eye (it did not hurt at all but i now have a small spot on my eyeld since)i immediately thought 'what on arth was that, as i do not have any lights outside my windows, being on the 4rth floor of an apartment block and overlooking the garden. i ran to look out of the window and could not beleive my eyes. directly in front overhead was the brightest ball of light ive ever seen, it was snow white. it was as bright as the moon but much larger and much lower, did not make a sound or did not move at all.I ran to tell my husband as i was very excited but he seemed very odd and did not even take a look. i ran back to my room where my daughter still was, and remember observing it for about 3 minutes. next thing i remember it was almost morning and the sun was almost up. i remember the object turned a glowing yellow color and simply disappeared. i realised then it was 6am. i only had one thought in my mind and it was' i watched it for 5 hrs. i do not recall my husband coming to bed and i do not remember if i went to work or anything really around several weeks after that. neither of us could remember anything else. in fact i forgot about it for several weeks until something jogged my memory at work and i remembered the incident. it was very strange because my husband loved photography and we had a camcorder and several cameras in the house. it did not even occur to me to take a picture and i know i definitly would have wanted to.
content.summary: Observed a huge glowy white ball shape, like a very large moon, outside my window overhead at 1am, what seemed like 5 minutes later, i realized it was 6am.

content.detailedDescription:
January 13, 2009. brian and chris {pid} and two friends were driving home from a meeting at florida international university at 1:00 am. they were heading west on s.W. 72nd street (sunset drive). chris, who was driving noticed the object first.  he said that it was so massive that it occupied 1/4 of the sky. he saw what appeared to be blue stars blinking around the edge of the object and  pulled the car over and the men got out to look at the object.  it was moving from southeast to northwest. chris said it was rectangular or oval shaped.

brian described the object as floating at a slanted angle the thickness of a house.  he said that he could not see the stars through the object and described it as "camouflaged" but with flickering blue lights around it. he felt panicky when he saw the object, but on recovering sent a text message to a friend in homestead (about 20 miles south).  

chris said the object was "as large as a football field".  brian said it was "as long as dolphin mall".  both said that the object made no sound and moved slowly across the sky. 

brian had had a previous sighting, also in miami on 152nd avenue between s.W. 72nd st.And s.W. 56th street. it was of three orange lights, all the size of the full moon in a triangular formation. it kept moving north.  the others in the car were shocked and confused and brian suffered a panic attack.  

mary margaret zimmer fl asd, fi
content.summary: Large rectangle with blue lights over miami, fl.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my way to work, traveling north on robertson rd. had just crossed the poison spider intersection when i saw what i thought at first was a falling star.I looked again and noticed it was going extremely fast as was flashing like a strobe light,i watched travel west over the road we were traveleing on then it suddenly took a hairpin turn back towards the east. it went east for probally a couple of miles,then headed north-west right in front of us,we were coming up on the zero rd. intersection where it started to descend right behind the large oil storage tankers that sit directly north of zero rd.As it decsended a dull red light appeared on what would be the bottom of the craft and it dissapeared behind the tanks.I believe it landed there. i was pretty skeptical before today, but after seeing what i saw, i believe!
content.summary: Flashing strobe moving extremely fast, east to west, back east, north, dull red light then lands.

content.detailedDescription: I was out on the padio haveing a cup of coffie and a cigeret as i do every morning, we dont smoke in the house.Then i saw a flash in the sky and looked up right away thinking it was a shooting star,but it was just a bright light setting there, then it started to pull away untill it was out of sight, not sideways like a plane, put straight out tword space. i sat there wandering what i just saw,was it a star dissapering in the lightining of the morning sky? no that takes quite a few mins this only took a few seconds, and i could still see all the other stars that werent as pright as that one was.Ok was it a nova? well maybe but it just seemed closer than a star as i watched it pull away.Well last resort was it a ufo? i dont know maybe. i sat there and lit another smoke and pondered over the options and i have no idea what i saw that morning.  so was there a nova  on the 29 or 30th of jan. at 7am or did i see a ufo, it was no plane or a star, let me know if theres a missing star sence that morning.
content.summary: I saw a flash and looked up and saw a light and watched it slowly pull straight away till out of sight.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: Please help.  i was comeing home from the mall with my mom and we seen a pyramid shaped object in the sky at first we thought it was atop a cell phone tower but as we moved in the car we could see it wasn't.  the shape was luminescent, it had a red light at the top and blue-ish light at the base.  it appeared to have a gray looking ora around it and it stayed in (silent) place for a few minutes then it shot so fast we couldn't see it to move to a higher spot in the sky then a few seconds later it did the same thing but was gone.  please help my mom refuses to call 911 and i'm scared shitless.....What if they comeback!!
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: A luminescent pyramid shaped object with red light at the tip and blue light at the base.

content.detailedDescription: Traveling highway speed northbound on i-65 at exactly 8:30 pm near franklin, ky - gps fix: n36 45 w86 29.  in the sky on right side, i saw a fast moving ball of light going northward, seemingly descending downward.  i thought it was a comet or shooting star.  the color was not white white but slightly off-white.  then there was a red "blip"  where most, not all of it flashed red, then it disappeared.  lasted for approx. 1 second.  it seemed strange because it seemed that at the end of its trajectory it speeded up quite a bit the split second before it vanished.  there was a major car accident several miles earlier, which had stopped interstate travel for about 1 hour.
content.summary: White light ball streaking down, then red, then gone.

content.detailedDescription: Its the same thing as my last post but this time i have picture11s
content.summary: Oshkosh, wisconsin ...Second night, second sighting.

content.detailedDescription:
on sunday february 2, 2009 at around 12:30 pm, my 29 year old son and i  were traveling north on us hwy 281 approximately 3 and 1/2 miles from morgan mill, texas. toward the north at about 30 degrees (that is just an estimate) i saw a bright flash of an object and almost at the same time, there was a long flash underneath the object.  i asked my son if he had seen it.  he said,"yes, what was that?"  i slowed down and kept looking in the direction of the object.  
  the northern horizon was a dark blue caused by a difference in temperature, i guess.   we lost sight of the thing and then spotted it at a greater distance going in a nne direction.  when we reached a safe place to stop, we stopped.  i took out my binoculars and scanned the area where we had spotted the object, but couldn't see it.  
  after scanning the area for several seconds, i did spot an object in the far distance that was long, flat cigar shaped.  it was so far that my binoculars couldn't make it out very well.  my son tried to spot it but it was gone.  the original object had moved out of our vision far faster than a weather balloon. i do not think that it was a jet because it had no vapor trail.  there were two jets crossing the same air space and they had long vapor trails.
content.summary: It was a metallic flash with a long metallic flash underneath.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
Marlton /medford, nj ufo observation report february 02, 2009

i have been observing an object in the evening sky which strobes occasionally (white, green, blue and red), and is almost impossible to focus in on with binoculars (7x35 power). when close to focus the object looks like a cone or jellyfish with colors continually changing. no sound.

this object moves erratically and quickly, up, down and left right also in circles but, stays within a boundary of approximately 5 miles (educated guess).

the objects position is typically trailing the constellation of the big dipper in the eastern skies starting at approximately 15-20 degrees above the horizon at 18:00 hours and then moving in the same trajectory as the big dipper later into the evening. a guess that it is at 50 to 100,000 feet above sea level.

this has been observed for the last 60 days by me and others that have observed it with me, so i have decided to report it.
content.summary: This object moves erratically and quickly, up, down and left right also in circles but, stays within a boundary of approximately 5 miles (educated guess).

content.detailedDescription:
This is the 3rd object like this we have seen since november 2008.

in november 2008 and 2x in january 2009.

the object makes no noise it does not move much if at all. 
it is very bright, brighter than any star.... and has different color lights.
content.summary: Multiple flashing strobe very bright  no noise and the object hovered in one spot.

content.detailedDescription:
I saw something weird in the sky the other night. 
 
on january 31, 2009 i was driving a car and heading west on magnolia blvd. near irvine ave. at about 10:15 pm
 
something came from right over me and streaked straight down across the sky in front of me and disappeared past the horizon. it was illuminated and i noticed the movement as it came into view through the top of th windsheild. my windows were open, but i heard no sound. i know the woman in the car next to me saw it too, but her windows were up and we did not communicate with each other. 
 
it was light bluish-green (more on the green side) and seemed like it was not too far up. it was clearly capsule-shaped, (rectangular with rounded edges like a tic tac mint) never blurred or faded, but seemed to be glowing from above.  it did not seem like it was in space. it looked clear or crisp like it was just over the valley. 
 
it was much faster than a plane, but not as fast as a shooting star or meteor, at least none that i have seen before. i was so sure that it was a close object that i was expecting a big crash or explosion or something on the horizon after i couldn't see it anymore.

i debated whether or not to call the police, but i did not. i have been looking on the news and online for the past couple of days to see if anyone else saw anything, but i have seen anything anywhere. 

i thought i should report it to someone and found your site online.
content.summary: A bluish-green capsule crossed the sky in about 6 seconds heading due west.

content.detailedDescription:
A black, swift triangular shape without sound or movement of air i barely caught with a blink, fly from south to north just a hair above the roof tops; and that was it. it seemed to be twice the size of a hang glider with a black fuzzy appearance.

late summer 2007, the day was clear and sunny with a few scattered clouds. i would guess if something moved 1000 plus mph, that's how fast it would move at thirty feet above the ground, blink, gone. but without sound? air rushing? shock waves? nothing. was it in my head? i was just grilling on the patio with daily life on my mind.

i wonder about it every now and then, was it my first ufo sighting or some freaky military craft from the air force base or aircraft companies within 50 miles of my house?
content.summary: Black trinagle, no sound, right over house in a blink.

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 8:00 pm, one night of fine weather, me, the other kids and many neighbors were outside.  (i lived in a busy neighborhood)  bright lights appeared above in the distance just past the tree and house line.  a huge, very slow moving object came closer in our direction.  one by one we outside noticed it.  then people ran into houses and told neighbors and family to come see.  many people came out and joined the street to see it. everybody watched it drawing closer, many thought it was a blimp at first.  as it passed directly over us it was absolutely silent and by the multicolored lights moving around it's side we could see it was a wide oval, almost round.  the lights did change color and seem to flow around its perimeter (like a blimp, but it's shape was not a blimp).  the lights were yellow, red, blue, and white.  they seemed to change places randomly and in both directions .

that's when everyone became amazed.  i'll never forget the reactions of people.  it moved so slowly that i had time to run home 400 yrds and tell my mother,  (who would'nt come look.) and make it back to join the crowd and watch it more.

it drifted away.  the next day there were reports all over the news and in the new haven paper.  sighted for miles, by many.  no real explanation was given.
content.summary: Slow moving, huge oval shaped object passes right above crowd.

content.detailedDescription: I was having study/prayer group and a friend who provides my transportation and i were driving like we usually do along k-7 homeward from the meeting. on my side (the passenger) i noticed the moon and made comment about a large star 12 degrees above the horizon and about 7-8 degrees to the left of the moon. i began thinking to myself that must be either saturn or venus. it was too large to be saturn and it would have been last month and december for that... i spoke out loud, "that must be venus." then i thought that can't be right. so this time when i look the object was closer towards the moon maintaining altitude at about 4-5 degrees away. "that's not a planet" i said, "it's moving!" it looked far too large to be a helicopter and too far away or we would have heard it. the driver's eye's opened wide dropjawed. i turned to look at it again and it had picked up pace. now k-7 was veering right and the moon us and the object were getting close to conjunction when suddenly the object zigzagged left and right across the road and over again the moon drivers side by now the object was on the right hand side of the moon about 10 degrees all the while maintaining platform altitude. k-7 was still veering away so we turned onto 63rd and genoa following the object. we made our way into a small subdivision passing 67th and turned into 67th terrace heading straight at it. unfortunately, that was a culdesac so we parked and got out for a clearer view. now the object remained motionless for ten minutes after the first five my driver friend called our hosts that evening to come out and see it and to bring a telescope or some binoculars. just before they arrived the object permeated slightly or pulsed off and on and drifted slightly side to side and downward when it did so. now the object was only about 6-7 degrees above horizon 10-11 degrees to the right of the moon and froze there for another ten minutes after our hosts had arrived. my driver and i were quite excited about all this so our male host peered at the object...He said, "that's no star that i've ever seen and he handed them to me. the object shrank on the lens and lost it's shining starlike aura. it appeared perfectly sphere like but was surrounded perfectly by a band of stark red very cutlike. it was chilly and i couldn't get a stable view as i would have liked trembling. our hosts counterpart couldn't even locate the object using the binoculars my driver did but her eyesight with glasses was poor. so both parties decide to drive to the object. they got in their truck we in our car and headed along 75th until that ran out and we then made our way onto 85th the object motionless the entire time. at some point before 75th my driver friend called her son excitedly explaining some details. later that evening her son said he was called at 9:20pm. so, we're following our hosts truck when the object maintaining altitude began losing us moving away above the road. our hosts with not as keen eyesight as mine lost the object and parked we beckoned them to follow us. we drove faster along k-10 now and the object smaller now and further away once again stopped. there were a few misturns along the way it took some work to make it to the inject through rural neighborhoods. now we were just leaving from desoto kansas on 95th and gaining quickly half way to lawrence kansas. after a few minutes 95th began to veer left away from the object a gigantic huge bright shining orb about a half mile or 2/3rd's mile away about 300 yards in diameter twice the width of the quarter crescent moon. appearing about 30 degrees above the horizon since we were positioned underneath it more and 25 degrees away from the moon still and to the right. we all stopped and parked getting out of our vehicles. suddenly the bright white shining light turned off and what remained was a ring composed of lit multicolored square panels that flashed off and on with various different colors perhaps even rotating...The flashes made that somewhat confusing though. it held that shape for only 5 seconds or less and then the flashes stopped and suddenly the object was square shaped or perhaps looked square front light white left side red to yellow pulsing blue light right and green light tail. the object moved along the horizon away from the moon dissappearing over olathe. at that point anyone would pass it for a plane.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.shape: Circle,  Cylinder,  Diamond,  Sphere,  Square,  Rectagular,  Star-like,  Other
content.summary: Sighted at shawnee mission chased object half way to lawrence

content.detailedDescription:
Taking the dog out for a walk, i will always look up in the sky to view the heavens. this night i saw something a little different. we were in the backyard of my home and just happened to look up toward the south and saw a flaming object coming toward earth at a 45 degree angle. it was heading westward. the color was red/yellow and i think mostly from the fire that was surrounding it. there was also a short tail of fire following. my first thought was a meteor, as i saw details on the surface of the object that appeared to be circles or craters. it was coming in at a very high rate of speed and i was only able to view it for a few seconds before it went out of sight behind some trees. the height from the earth was lower than a jetliner, i'd guess about 20,000 feet. the size was very large, i would compare it to about half the size of the moon (although the flames surrounding it could have made it look larger). i would say at the way it was heading it would have crashed about 50-100 miles away. it was close enough that i was waiting to feel or hear an impact, but did not.
a side note, the next morning i noticed some army helicopters flying over toward the area i viewed the sighting. it is a rare thing (only once i've noticed in ten years) to see these fly over our place.

i've seen many things in the sky and many shooting stars, but nothing ever this close and vivid.


have you any other reports of this?
content.summary: Flaming fireball from the sky.
